description:
'''Tropipop''' (also known as '''Colombian pop'''{{Citation needed|date=March 2023|reason=Colombian pop is generally much wider than tropipop}} and '''Trop-pop''') is a [[music genre]] that developed in [[Colombia]] in the late 1990s and early 2000s. It is a blend of [[Music of Colombia#Caribbean Region of Colombia|traditional musical forms]] of the [[Caribbean Region of Colombia]], mainly [[vallenato]], with foreign Latin genres such as [[Salsa music|salsa]] and [[Merengue music|merengue]], and pop and [[pop rock]]. The term "tropipop" comes from the [[portmanteau]] of the words "[[Tropical music|tropical]]" and "pop music" describing the genre's mix of Latin tropical roots with [[American popular music]].

Some popular tropipop acts are [[Fanny Lu]], [[Fonseca (singer)|Fonseca]], [[Bonka (band)|Bonka]], [[Mauricio & Palodeagua]], [[Lucas Arnau]] and the internationally successful [[Carlos Vives]].
